p: Numerous medicinal single-species floral teas were recorded in Hatay Province (Turkey), including Antakya and Defne, by Güzel et al., (2015) and Güzel and Guzelsemme, (2018), with Achillea setacea Waldst & Kit., Alcea setosa (Boiss.) Alef., Calicotome villosa (Poir.) Link, Cistus creticus L., Cota palaestina Kotschy, Eleagnos angustifolia L., Erica manipuliflora Salisb., Helichrysum sanguineum (L.) Kostel., H. plicatum DC., and H. stoechas (L.) Moench, Hibiscus sabdariffa L., Lavandula stoechas L., Malva punctata (All.) Alef., Matricaria chamomilla L., Punica granatum L., Rosa x damascena Mill., Sambucus nigra L., Sideritis huber-morathii Greuter & Burdet, S. libanotica Labill., S. perfoliata L., S. syriaca subsp. nusairiensis (Post) Hub.-Mor. or Viola odorata L., among others, but no information on mixtures. Although to a lesser extent, Akgül et al. (2016) also recorded single-species floral teas in Cappadocia (Turkey), Akgul et al. (2018) in Mardin Province (Turkey), Güneş et al. (2017) in Adana Province (Turkey) and Sargin et al. (2015) in Manisa (Turkey).
